title: The Hunger Games
author: Suzanne Collins
description: In a dystopian future, 16-year-old Katniss Everdeen volunteers to take her younger sister's place in a fight-to-the-death televised event known as the Hunger Games.

title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
description: The first book in the beloved Harry Potter series, in which a young orphan boy discovers he is a wizard and begins his magical education at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: The unforgettable novel of a childhood in a sleepy Southern town and the crisis of conscience that rocked it.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: The story of the fabulously wealthy Jay Gatsby and his love for the beautiful Daisy Buchanan.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society, depicting a world where the government has total control over every aspect of people's lives.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A classic novel of manners and morals, set in the early 19th century in England, where the five Bennett sisters must navigate the challenges of love and society.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: The story of Holden Caulfield, a young man who is struggling to find his place in the world after being expelled from his prep school.

title: Animal Farm
author: George Orwell
description: A political allegory depicting the events leading up to the Russian Revolution of 1917 and the early years of the Soviet Union.

title: Lord of the Flies
author: William Golding
description: A novel about a group of British boys who are stranded on an uninhabited island and must fend for themselves, leading to a descent into savagery.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A novel set in a futuristic society where people are genetically engineered and conditioned to live a life of conformity and happiness.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: The story of Bilbo Baggins, a hobbit who embarks on a quest to reclaim a treasure stolen by a dragon.

title: The Da Vinci Code
author: Dan Brown
description: A thriller novel that follows symbologist Robert Langdon and cryptologist Sophie Neveu as they investigate a murder in Paris's Louvre Museum.
